newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Euroyen off highs but well supported.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Euroyen off highs but well supported.

text.p: SIMEX Euroyen futures were stuck in a two-tick band on Tuesday but remained well supported as players lacked the conviction to push the market higher after Japanese government bond (JGB) futures ran into resistance.
Dealers said a report by the Japanese Economic Planning Agency (EPA) suggesting continued weakness in housing construction and poor consumption data helped underpin the market.
"The EPA report showed the economy as still being weak so that provided good support for Euroyen futures," a trader at a U.S. investment house said.
He said the lead March Euroyen contract should consolidate in a 99.16-99.23 range for the time being. At 1110 GMT, it was unchanged against its IMM close of 99.17.

Dealers said JGB futures came off their highs as Tokyo stocks recouped some of their losses before the close. The lead September contract ended at 126.41 against a previous 126.53 after hitting a high of 126.79.
Eurodollar futures dipped in thin trade as players continued to adjust their positions after the release of bullish U.S. data last Friday.

Dealers said an unexpected rise in non-farm payrolls for July and in the National Association of Purchasing Management's indices of industry activity had brought the possibility of a U.S. rate hike back on the horizon.
December Eurodollars ended unchanged against an IMM close at 94.095 on volume of 3,755 lots.
